content: A Dropdown displays a list of actions or options. It's composed of `Dropdown`, `DropdownTrigger`, `DropdownMenu`, and `DropdownItem`. It supports both static and dynamic collections of items.
Dropdown supports different selection modes: `none`, `single`, or `multiple`. Use `onAction` to handle item activation and `onSelectionChange` for selection.

Items can have `startContent`/`endContent` (for icons), a `description`, and a `shortcut`. You can group items with `DropdownSection`. Any component can be a trigger by wrapping it in `DropdownTrigger`.

Dropdown items have `variants` for hover effects. The backdrop of the popover can be changed (`transparent`, `opaque`, `blur`). Custom styles can be applied to all item slots via `itemClasses` on the `DropdownMenu`.
The Dropdown is fully accessible with keyboard navigation (Arrow keys, Enter, Esc) and ARIA attributes for menus.
